---
title: "Settings file"
---
The model settings are configured in a *settings.toml* file. The configuration file consists of important core information and can be extended with a range of optional input, see @tbl-toml:

::: {.callout-note}
File paths in the settings can be relative to the settings.toml file or absolute.
:::

| Field                    | Example                                  | Required                           | Description                                                                                                          |
|------------------------------|------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **[global]**                 |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| crs                          | 'EPSG:32617'                             | No                                  | Projection                                                                                                    |
| gdal_cache                   | 10                                       | No                                  | Set the GDAL cache in megabytes to restrict the footprint of GDAL                                             |
| keep_temp_files              | False                                    | No                                  | True/False                                                                                                    |
| thread                       | 4                                        | No                                  | Set the number of threads of the calculations                                                                 |
| **[global grid]**            |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| chunk                        | [1024, 1014]                             | No                                  | Set grid chunk size                                                                                           |
| **[output]**                 |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| path                         | 'output'                                 | Yes                                 | Set directory path to save the output                                                                         |
| **[output.csv]**             |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| name                         | 'output.csv'                             | Yes                                 | File name of the output csv                                                                                   |
| **[output.geom]**            |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| name1                        | 'spatial.gpkg'                           | Yes                                 | File name of the output vector data                                                                           |
| **[output.grid]**            |                                          | optional                            |                                                                                                               |
| name                         | 'output.nc'                              | Yes, if working with grid           | File name for the output for the grid model; **WARN: not fully implemented yet**                                  |
| **[hazard]**                 |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| file                         | 'hazard/event_map.nc'                    | Yes                                 | Path to hazard file (raster or netCDF). Can contain one (for events) or multiple (for return periods) bands   |
| crs                          | 'EPSG:32617'                             | Yes, if crs is unknown in dataset   | Projection of hazard data                                                                                     |
| elevation_reference          | 'dem'                                    | Yes                                 | DEM or Datum for a water depth or water elevation map                                                         |
| risk                         | True                                     | Yes                                 | True/False If true, risk (EAD) is calculated                                                                  |
| return_periods               | [2, 5, 10, 25]                           | No                                  | Return periods for hazard calculation when they cannot be inferred from the data itself                       |
| **[hazard.settings]**        |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| chunk                        | [1024, 1014]                             | No                                  | Set chunk size (Advise to use the setting under global.grid)                                                  |
| subset                       | 'zs'                                     | No                                  | Specific layer from a multilayered netCDF file (GDAL can't read those properly)                               |
| var_as_band                  | False                                    | No                                  | True/False Read netCDF subdatasets as raster bands                                                            |
| **[exposure.geom]**          |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| csv                          | 'exposure/exposure.csv'                  | Yes                                 | All additional info for the vector data                                                                       |
| file1                        | 'exposure/buildings.gpkg'                | Yes                                 | File path of exposure vector file with Object ID column to enable linking exposure.csv output to vector file. |
| crs                          | 'EPSG:32617'                             | Yes, if crs is unknown in dataset   | Projection of exposure data                                                                                   |
| index                        | 'Object ID'                              | Yes                                 | Set index column of the data                                                                                  |
| **[exposure.grid]**          |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| file                         | 'exposure/raster.nc'                     | Yes, if netCDF is provided as input |                                                                                                               |
| crs                          | 'EPSG:32617'                             | Yes, if crs is unknown in dataset   | Output projection                                                                                             |
| **[exposure.grid.settings]** |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| chunk                        | [1024, 1014]                             | No                                  | Set chunk size (Advise to use the setting under global.grid)                                                  |
| var_as_band                  | True                                     | No                                  | True/False Read netCDF subdatasets as raster bands                                                            |
| **[vulnerability]**          |                                          |                                     |                                                                                                               |
| file                         | 'vulnerability/vulnerability_curves.csv' | Yes                                 | Damage functions for impact assessment                                                                        |
| step_size                    | 0.01                                     | No                                  | Interpolation scale for the vulnerability curves                                                              |
: Settings.toml input (required and optional fields) {#tbl-toml .striped .hover .column-page-inset-right}

Below an example of what a *settings.toml* could look like considering required fields only:

***Mini settings.toml** (soley required fields):*
```html
[output]
path = "output"

[output.csv]
name = "output.csv"

[output.geom]
name1 = "spatial.gpkg"

[hazard]
file = "hazard/SL_10yr_reprojected.tif"
crs = "EPSG:4326"
elevation_reference = "DEM"
risk = false

[exposure.geom]
csv = "./exposure/exposure.csv"
crs = "EPSG:4326"
file1 = "./exposure/buildings.gpkg"

[vulnerability]
file = "./vulnerability/vulnerability_curves.csv"

```
